com.hcl.leap.api

Class LeapHelperFilterParam

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hcl.leap.api.LeapHelperFilterParam

  • public class LeapHelperFilterParam
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a FEB REST API Filter object. A filter is made up of a parameter, an operator and a value. The parameter is a field ID (i.e. F_Name), the operator determines how the value will be evaluated (i.e. "equals", "contains", "lt") and the value is the string that you are searching for. Usage: 1. Create a FEBFilter array: 
      FEBFilter[] filters = new FEBFilter[2];
    2. Add the filters: 
      filters[0] = new FEBFilter("F_Status",FEBFilterOperator.EQUALS,"Closed");
        filters[1] = new FEBFilter("F_Owner",FEBFilterOperator.EQUALS,"Christopher Dawes");
    3. Add the filters array to the function: 
      r = fa.listRecords(appid, "F_Form1", filters, 0, 10, FEBFilterRelationship.ALL_MATCH);
    Author:
    ChristopherDawes
    See Also:
    REST API - List Filters

    • Method Detail

      • getFilterString

        public java.lang.String getFilterString()
        Generates the formatted filter string to add to the FEB REST URL. The format of the generated string is: "<param>__<operator>=<value>"
        Returns:
        String
